      <title><![CDATA[Another Nirav in making? Vikram Kothari of Rotomac Pens goes 'missing']]></title>

      <description><![CDATA[Kothari took loan of Rs. 3.52 billion from Kanpur branch of Allahabad Bank and Rs. 4.85 billion from three other banks: Bank of Baroda, Indian Overseas Bank, and Union Bank of India]]></description>

    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[PNB fraud: Nirav Modi team given access to bank computers, say CBI sources]]></title>
      <link>http://www.business-standard.com/article/finance/pnb-fraud-nirav-modi-team-given-access-to-bank-computers-say-cbi-sources-118021800165_1.html</link>
      <guid>http://www.business-standard.com/article/finance/pnb-fraud-nirav-modi-team-given-access-to-bank-computers-say-cbi-sources-118021800165_1.html</guid>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 19:43:00 +0530</pubDate>
      <imageThumb><![CDATA[http://bsmedia.business-standard.com/_media/bs/img/hp/home-page/2018-02/18/5784/thumb/1518881887-5006.jpg]]></imageThumb>
      <description><![CDATA[During interrogation, the arrested bank officials revealed that Modi's staff were logging into the SWIFT system using passwords of PNB officials]]></description>
      <media:group>
        <media:description><![CDATA[During interrogation, the arrested bank officials revealed that Modi's staff were logging into the SWIFT system using passwords of PNB officials]]></media:description>
        <media:content url="http://www.business-standard.com/article/finance/pnb-fraud-nirav-modi-team-given-access-to-bank-computers-say-cbi-sources-118021800165_1.html" height="275" width="370" medium="image"/>

        <media:credit>Reuters</media:credit>
      </media:group>
    </item>

    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[FPIs pull out $1 bn from Indian markets in Feb in wake of global sell-off]]></title>
      <link>http://www.business-standard.com/article/markets/fpis-pull-out-1-bn-from-indian-markets-in-feb-in-wake-of-global-sell-off-118021800130_1.html</link>
      <guid>http://www.business-standard.com/article/markets/fpis-pull-out-1-bn-from-indian-markets-in-feb-in-wake-of-global-sell-off-118021800130_1.html</guid>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 12:57:00 +0530</pubDate>
      <imageThumb><![CDATA[http://bsmedia.business-standard.com/_media/bs/img/hp/home-page/2018-02/18/5784/thumb/1510944972-9781.jpg]]></imageThumb>
      <description><![CDATA[This is against the total inflow of over Rs 137.8 billion by foreign portfolio investors in January, the latest data with depositories showed]]></description>
